authors.name: Konrad Büssow
authors.affiliation: Helmholtz Centre for Infection Research, Braunschweig, Germany

before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"66r5q","text":"The expression plasmid pCAD29 (pCAD29_hIRG1_4-461_pvp008, Addgene #124843) is used. It contains the coding sequence of human ACOD1, amino acids 4-461, with an N-terminal Streptag and TEV protease cleavage site. The plasmid has a T7 promoter, which is induced by autoinduction here. The method and the plasmid have been described by Chen et al. (F. Chen et al., Crystal structure of cis-aconitate decarboxylase reveals the impact of naturally occurring human mutations on itaconate synthesis. 2019. PNAS 116, 20644-20654).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":4,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":262,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":352,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":498,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3nrh5","text":"The ACOD1 protein is purified from the cell lysate using Strep-Tactin XT affinity chromatography. A buffer containing 50 mM biotin is used for elution. Attaching the elution buffer with small size tubing to the chromatography system saves costly biotin. The volume for washing the pump with elution buffer can also be minimized, e.g. 5 ml is sufficient on an ÄKTAprime system.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":57,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8ko0k","text":"For a good overexpression of the enzyme, it is important that aeration of the autoinduction cultures is sufficient and that the E. coli cells grow to high density. Polyethyleneimine (PEI) is added to the cell lysates for precipitation of nucleic acids. This leads to a better separation of insoluble material by centrifugation and seems to improve reproducibility and yield of the process. A yield of 5-10 mg can be expected.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":128,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":164,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9jqc2","text":"Removing the StrepTag by TEV digest is necessary for protein crystallization, but may not be required for other applications. TEV protease was produced with Addgene plasmid pRK793 (Plasmid #8827, Kapust et al., 2001) and stored frozen at -80°C in 1 ml aliquots.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":25,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":126,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":173,"length":6},{"key":1,"offset":196,"length":19}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C8D5231009C611EE80B2DBC2067B09FC","url":"https://www.addgene.org/8827"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"D5404E4009C611EE80B2DBC2067B09FC","url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/protein/14.12.993"}}}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"5snbm","text":"This protocol describes the purification of the human enzyme cis-aconitate decarboxylase (ACOD1) from recombinant E. coli cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":61,"length":3},{"style":"italic","offset":114,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Any action you take or refrain from taking using or relying upon the information presented here is strictly at your own risk. You agree that neither the Company nor any of the authors, contributors, administrators, or anyone else associated with protocols.io, can be held responsible for your use of the information contained in or linked to this protocol or any of our Sites/Apps and Services.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":12},{"key":1,"offset":631,"length":12}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"url":"http://protocols.io"}}}}
keywords: cis-aconitate decarboxlase, ACOD1, Strep-tag II, Strep-Tactin XT, itaconate, itaconic acid

W. Studier, Protein production by auto-induction in high density shaking cultures. Protein Expr. Purif.41, 207-234 (2005).","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":90,"length":20},{"style":"bold","offset":110,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"94jbm","text":"    F. (2014).\n","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":98,"length":18},{"style":"bold","offset":116,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"artki","text":"Stock solutions","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"auqp5","text":"1 M Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, autoclaved","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dlk7l","text":"5 M NaCl, autoclaved","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bniu","text":"1 M DTT ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t58b","text":"100 mM HEPES pH 7.4 (NaOH) ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b90pl","text":"500 mM TCEP, neutralised with NaOH, stored at -20°C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"55vch","text":" Wash Buffer","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36loj","text":"20 mM Tris, pH 8.0","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ii0e","text":"0.5 M NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2nfj6","text":"10% (v/v) glycerol ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j52f","text":"1 mM DTT","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dq45g","text":"ElutionBuffer","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"34k4a","text":"50 mM biotin in Wash Buffer","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f6tc","text":"pH 8.0 (NaOH)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"16ua1","text":"GF Buffer","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"259d9","text":"10 mM HEPES pH 7.4","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bn7c7","text":"150 mM NaCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qtop","text":"10% (v/v) glycerol ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2sonv","text":"0.1 mM TCEP","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ctucf","text":"10% PEI, pH 8.0 (HCl)","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab2qm","text":"MP Biomedicals No. 195444, 50% (w/v) PEI in H2O. Mw= 50000-100000","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":45,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"70h0o","text":"Dilute in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8gaak","text":"Adjust pH to 8.0 with HCl","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"apqto","text":"Adjust PEI concentration to 10% (w/v)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f9217","text":"Reagents and Equipment","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ehad7","text":"Expression plasmid pCAD29 (pCAD29_hIRG1_4-461_pvp008, Addgene #124843)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aob8d","text":"E. coli BL21(DE3) CodonPlus-RIL competent cells","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4ibj4","text":"Kanamycin, 100 mg/ml in water","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"br522","text":"Chloramphenicol, 34 mg/ml in ethanol","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"21asn","text":"SOC agar plates","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eikso","text":"Lysozyme ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ovnh","text":"Biotin","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ai0r4","text":"Strep-Tactin XT superflow, 50% suspension (IBA GmbH)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"645rf","text":"YMC ECO15/200M0V or similar empty column","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1a73l","text":"TEV protease","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2u6rg","text":"Syringe filter, 0.45 µm, Sartorius Minisart Plus","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f2vft","text":"Vivaspin 20, MWCO 30,000 concentrator","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"39il3","text":"High pressure homogeniser or sonifier. E.g. Avestin EmulsiFlex-C3 homogenizer or Bandelin Sonoplus 2000 Sonifier with a TT13Z probe","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b24a5","text":"Äkta chromatography machine, 4 ml Strep-Tactin XT column, Superdex 200 26/60 column","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7ab1t","text":"SDS-PAGE equipmentAll buffers should be vacuum-filtered through a 0.45 µm filter.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7jrnk","text":"\n","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6gbh1","text":"","type":"header-two","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"5dknd","text":"Inoculate 20 ml MDAG-135 containing 100 mg/L kanamycin and chloramphenicol with a colony and shake over night at 37°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4a0bg","text":"Prepare 4×1 L ZYM-5052 medium with 100 mg/L kanamycin and 34 mg/L chloramphenicol in 2.8 L baffled Fernbach flasks. Inoculate each Fernbach flask with 4 ml overnight culture and shake 24 h at 130 rpm and 25°C. Ensure sufficient aeration of the flasks, do not close them too tightly.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2chsl","text":"Check the OD600 of the culture, 12-14 is expected. Dilute the cells 1:20 in water before measurement. Harvest the cells by centrifugation for 20 min at 5000 rpm. Discard the supernatant. Weigh the cell pellets. Up to 100 g wet cell mass is expected. Using a silicone spatula, transfer the cells to a 500 ml beaker. Rinse the centrifugation flasks and the spatula with Wash Buffer. Add the same volume of buffer as the cell volume. Place the beaker on ice. Resuspend the cells with a magnetic stirrer in a cold room. Transfer the cell suspension to 50 ml polypropylene tubes, freeze in liquid N2 and store at -80°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":12,"length":3}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1p65j","text":"Transform BL21(DE3) CodonPlus-RIL E. coli cells with the plasmid pCAD29. Plate the cells on a SOC agar plate containing 30 mg/L kanamycin and 34 mg/L chloramphenicol and incubate at 37°C overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":34,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9k2en","text":"Prepare a 4 ml Strep-Tactin XT column. Use an empty YMC ECO15/200M0V or similar column. Prepare buffers and 10% PEI.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d92ch","text":"Thaw up to 100 g cell suspension in warm water. Transfer to a 500 ml beaker before thawing is complete. Mix the suspension with a magnetic stirrer. Place on ice when thawing is complete.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9a2k7","text":"Increase the volume to 250 ml with Wash Buffer. Lyse the cells by sonication or with a high-pressure homogenizer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ddaci","text":"Sonication with a Bandlin Sonoplus 2000 Sonifier and a TT13FZ probe:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5r823","text":"Place the beaker with the cells on ice. Immerse the probe half way, about 2 cm, into the cell suspension. Set the amplitude to 58%. For 30 min, run cycles of 1 s sonfication and 9 s pause.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a2b31","text":"Remove 2 µl lysate, mix with 8 µl H2O and 4 µl 4×SDS-PAGE sample buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dimfg","text":"Add 13 ml 10% PEI per 100 g cells (add less PEI for less cells). Mix, place on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"camkf","text":"Centrifuge for 45 min at 4°C and 16,500 rpm or higher speed. Repeat if supernatants are not clear. Collect the supernatants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dgklj","text":"Remove 2 µl lysate, mix with 8 µl H2O and 4 µl 4×SDS-PAGE sample buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"n3cv","text":"Using a 50 ml syringe, filter the supernatant through 0.45 µm syringe filters.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"h5rg","text":"Chromatography can be done at room temperature with an ÄKTAPrime Plus. Mount the 4 ml StrepTactin XT column on an Äkta chromatography system. Equilibrate the column with Wash Buffer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"13jip","text":"Apply the cleared cell lysate to the column at 3 ml/min. Place the lysate bottle on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"dpkqe","text":"Wash the column with 30 ml Wash Buffer at 3 ml/min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"61lj3","text":"Equilibrate the pump with 5 ml Elution Buffer. Elute the protein with 15 ml Elution Buffer at 1 ml/min, collecting 2 ml fractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"nbs","text":"Analyse the lysate aliquots, the flow through and the elution fractions by SDS-PAGE. Determine the protein concentration in the fractions by A280 measurement.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2b1cu","text":"This step is optional. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"jbdt","text":"Add 1 ml of 1 mg/ml TEV protease (Kapust et al., 2001) and mix gently. Incubate in a refrigerator overnight.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":19}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5D850F8009C611EE80B2DBC2067B09FC","url":"https://doi.org/10.1093/protein/14.12.993"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"328pc","text":"Transfer the protein into 2 ml microcentrifuge tubes and centrifuge for 30 min at maximum speed. Pool the supernatants.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1mtep","text":"Compare the protein size before and after TEV by SDS-PAGE, loading 100 ng protein.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6aarg","text":"Equilibrate a Superdex 200 26/60 column with GF Buffer. Apply the protein to the column with a 10 ml sample loop. Elute the protein at 2.5 ml/min and collect 5 ml eluate fractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e01aj","text":"Analyse peak fractions by SDS-PAGE. Pool peak fractions and add TCEP to 1 mM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6r827","text":"Concentrate the protein with a Vivaspin 20, MWCO 30,000 concentrator (Sartorius), as needed. Aliquot the protein in 200 µl PCR tubes, freeze in liquid nitrogen and store at -80°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"8tgdb","text":"Pool the peak fractions.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Purification of ACOD1 expressed in E. coli
